contextId.information: Implicit information here can be made explicit. Either Hannah's tent was next to the tabernacle tent or she walked from her tent to the tabernacle to pray. AT: "Hannah rose up and went to the house of Yahweh to pray after" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Hannah rose up after

contextId.information: Hannah was deeply troubled or grieved because of not having any children and being ridiculed regularly by Peninnah, her husband's other wife. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: She was deeply distressed

contextId.information: The person who actually did the burning can be made explicit. AT: "the man who was sacrificing took his sacrifice to the priests and the priests burned" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they burned

contextId.information: "When the people carried the ark of the covenant of Yahweh into the camp" Some languages may need to add understood information to make the meaning clear. AT: "The people, along with Hophni and Phinehas, picked up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and carried it into the camp. When the people carried the ark into the camp" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: When the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came into the camp

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) the people denied themselves water as part of fasting or 2) they got water out of a stream or well and poured it on the ground as an outward sign of being sorry for their sin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: drew water and poured it out before Yahweh

contextId.information: It can be stated plainly that it was the army and not the rulers by themselves who attacked Israel. AT: "the Philistine rulers led their army and attacked Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the rulers of the Philistines attacked Israel

contextId.information: What Saul was doing on the rooftop can be made explicit. AT: "while Saul was sleeping on the rooftop, Samuel called to him and said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Samuel called to Saul on the rooftop and said

contextId.information: By this statement, Samuel is challenging the people to speak up if he has done anything wrong to anyone. AT: "I stand in front of you now. I ask you to speak in front of Yahweh and his anointed king if I have done you any wrong" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Here I am; testify against me before Yahweh and before his anointed one

contextId.information: The people did evil and were afraid of God destroying them. AT: "Do not be afraid that God will be angry and destroy you because of this sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Do not be afraid

contextId.information: The people are filled with fear because of the rain and thunder that Yahweh sent when Samuel prayed. Some people may believe Samuel would use his prayers to harm them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: far be it from me that I should sin against Yahweh by ceasing to pray for you

contextId.information: He did this because it was very steep. This could be made explicit. AT: "So Jonathan climbed up, using his hands and his feet because it was very steep" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Jonathan climbed up on his hands and feet

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state the cause. AT: "God caused the ground to shake" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The earth quaked

contextId.information: This does not refer to an ambush. These soldiers were hiding because they were afraid of the Philistines. This can be stated explicitly. AT: "the Israelite soldiers who were afraid and had hidden themselves in the hills" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the men of Israel who had hidden themselves in the hills

contextId.information: The were so hungry they did not drain the blood first before eating. This was a violation of the Law which was given to Moses for the nation of Israel. This can be made explicit. AT: "ate them without draining the blood first as required by the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: ate them with the blood

contextId.information: This was a violation of the Law which was given to Moses for the nation of Israel. This can be made explicit. AT: "by eating meat without draining the blood first as required by the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]]
contextId.quote: by eating with the blood

contextId.information: The stone would hold the animals up and make it easier to drain the blood from them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Now, roll a big stone here to me

contextId.information: The people remained silent because most of them knew that Jonathan had broken Saul's oath. This can be stated explicitly. AT: "His men knew who was guilty, but none of them said anything to Saul" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But none of the men among all the people answered him

contextId.information: Saul did this to try to stop Samuel from leaving. This can be stated explicitly. AT: "Saul tried to stop him by grabbing the edge of Samuel's robe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Saul took hold of the hem of his robe

contextId.information: This refers back to when Saul tore Samuel's robe in [[:en:bible:notes:1sa:15:26|15:27]]. This can be made explicit. AT: "Just as you tore my robe, Yahweh has torn the kingdom of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh has torn the kingdom of Israel

contextId.information: It seems the elders were trembling because they were worried that Samuel came to rebuke them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The elders of the city were trembling as they came to meet him

contextId.information: It is implied that he rose up after they sat down to eat. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Samuel rose up and went

contextId.information: The implied information is that these are the sons of Jesse. AT: "The three oldest sons of Jesse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The three oldest

contextId.information: It can be stated clearly that the Israelites were killing the Philistines as they chased them. AT: "And they killed the Philistines as they chased them, and the bodies of the dead Philistines were on the ground along the way to Shaaraim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The dead Philistines lay along the way to Shaaraim

contextId.information: The reason why the men thought David was in bed can be made explicit. AT: "If he really is too sick to come to me, bring me the bed with him in it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Bring him up to me in the bed

contextId.information: You may need to say clearly that Doeg saw what David did. AT: "Doeg ... herdsmen, and he saw what Ahimelech did" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Doeg ... herdsmen

contextId.information: You may need to make explicit what the young man did before he spoke with Abigail. AT: "One of Nabal's servants found out what David and his men were planning to do, so he went to Nabal's wife Abigail" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal's wife

contextId.information: A loaf is like a cake. You may need to make explicit what the loaves consisted of. AT: "loaves of bread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: loaves

contextId.information: You may need to make explicit what Abigail did after she arose and before she rode. AT: "quickly did what she needed to do to prepare for the journey, and then she rode" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: hurried and arose, and rode

contextId.information: You may need to make explicit the reason he will give an offering. AT: "I will give him an offering so he will no longer cause you to be angry with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: let him accept an offering
